newsitem.title: USA: CBOT soybeans called to open three to 10 cts lower.
newsitem.headline: CBOT soybeans called to open three to 10 cts lower.

text.p: CBOT soybean futures were called to open three to 10 cents per bushel lower on follow through from Monday's lower close, traders said.
Soybeans Monday fell the 30-cent limit in most months on a bearish acreage report from the U.S. Agriculture Department.
CBOT's Project A overnight trend for soybeans was 2-1/4 to 9-1/2 cents per bushel lower.
Soybeans Tuesday will trade with expanded 45-cent-per-bushel trading limits as a result of the limit move on Monday.
July was expected to be underpinned by the posting Tuesday of no deliveries on that contract.
Nearly ideal crop weather in the U.S. Midwest and improving crop condition ratings also were bearish for prices, the traders said.
USDA Monday said as of Sunday, 65 percent of the U.S. soybean crop was good to excellent, above the 61 percent in that category the previous week.
